title: Visual Indicator for Miss Fortune's W Stacks
body: I know a lot has already been said about Miss Fortune's strengths, weaknesses, consistency issues, etc. but one thing that has always bugged me about her that I almost never see anyone mention is that you have no way to tell how many stacks of your W you have on a target unless you manually mouse over and click them. This isn't an immense issue I understand, but it would be nice to be able to easily tell if the stacks have fallen off someone if she keeps dodging in and out of a fight. It bugs me a bit because virtually every champion who has a mechanic similar to MF's W, i.e. Twitch, Vayne, Varus, etc., all have some sort of visual indicator for their current stacks. Maybe just add some small circling hearts, similar to when she has her passive up? I just think it would be a nice QOL change to her, what do you think?

replies.body: MF is getting some tweaks in the pretty near future, and I believe that part of this package is better visualization for Impure Shots.
I think impure shots does really little damage compared to varus W stacks aswell, it feels a bit lackluster, is it a possibility that it may have a little damage buff?

I'd like it if they changed her ult passive so that instead of increasing how many stacks she gets for her impure shots, it'll instead improve the effectiveness of the stacks by so they deal 6% then 7.3%, 8.6%, 10% of her total Ad in magic damage. Because as the game goes on and she gets items, most enemies can't even live long enough when being auto'd by her to even GET 8 stacks of her Impure Shots.

Like the suggestion I read for her to have an unbreakable strut active during her impure shots would be too much, but I'm looking forward to seeing what you guys do with her :)
Would be interesting to see an indicator. It isn't a huge deal but would be a big QoL change that Miss Fortune deserves.

Someone else made the suggestion as well, and I thought I'd repost my idea on how such a visual indicator would work due to her somewhat high stack count.

First few shots add a small indicator each, and then after a certain number, group up into a bigger indicator before counting again.

An example (small = 1 stack; big = 4 stacks)
> 1 Stack: 1 small
2 Stacks: 2 small
3 Stacks: 3 small
4 Stacks: 1 big
5 Stacks: 1 big + 1 small
6 Stacks: 1 big + 2 small
7 Stacks: 1 big + 3 small
8 Stacks: 2 big
